unit: Unit 6 | Inference for Categorical Data: Proportions
title: Part $2$: Which Interval is Wider?
question_text: A group of students has collected data from a random sample. They need to decide between a $90\%$ confidence interval or a $99\%$ confidence interval. How will these intervals differ?

choices.text: To determine which confidence interval will be wider, we need to know the sample size.
To determine which confidence interval will be wider, we need to know whether we used a z z -statistics or a t t -statistic.
The 90 % 90 % confidence interval and 99 % 99 % confidence interval will be the same length, as they are both from the same random sample.
The 90 % 90 % confidence interval will be wider than the 99 % 99 % confidence interval.
The 99 % 99 % confidence interval will be wider than the 90 % 90 % confidence interval.
